subject: Boston Marathon
Marathon Running
lead_paragraph: The American Kara Goucher felt so good after finishing third in the Boston Marathon that she wanted to run in the London Marathon this Sunday. But her coach, Alberto Salazar, has rejected those plans. The races on back-to-back weekends would have been unprecedented for a top runner after a top finish. But the slow pace in Boston, along with the expectation of a long layoff — Goucher is going to try to start a family — left Goucher wanting a quick turnaround. She was serious enough that Salazar called in other top coaches to see if it was possible to run a second marathon six days after the first and still have a chance to win.
